title: David Luiz STILL feeling effects of Sergio Aguero horror tackle as Chelsea nurse defender through rest of season
text:

David Luiz will be carefully nursed through the rest of the season – because he is still feeling the effects of Sergio Aguero’s horror tackle three months ago. 
Chelsea star Luiz has yet to fully recover from the knee injury he suffered when he was taken out by Manchester City striker Aguero’s wild, red-card challenge on December 3. 
Blues boss Antonio Conte branded the knee-high shocker “dangerous” and admitted he feared for the Brazilian after watching re-runs which revealed just how bad the tackle was. 
Luiz, 29, has been able to feature in every league game since but is still being troubled by the injury and requiring treatment. He played against Burnley with strapping on his right knee. 
Conte has rested his key defender when he can, leaving him out of Chelsea’s three FA Cup games so far, including last week’s win at Wolves. David Luiz receives medical treatment (Photo: Getty Images) Aguero is shown a red card (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) Luiz in action against Burnley (Photo: Reuters) 
But the Blues believe only an extended period of rest in the summer will give him the time he needs to properly get over the problem. 
Until then Conte and his medical staff will have to manage Luiz’s workload and fitness. 
Luiz has been key to table topping Chelsea’s title bid and Conte says he will “realise a dream” if he goes onto lead the Blues to the title. 
He likened winning the Premier League to triumphing in a war and believes creating a family spirit at Stamford Bridge is a key factor in their success. 
Conte said: “To win, not only one game, not one [battle] but the whole war it is important to create a good spirit. Chelsea boss Antonio Conte (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Luiz celebrates with Conte (Photo: REUTERS) 
“To create a team, and to try to exploit every single player, the talent of every single player in the best way. 
“And for this reason to find the right solution, the right system, to create a family spirit, a good spirit. 
“Then in the negative moments it’s important to have a family. If you have a family, you solve the situation and then can go forward. 
“This is very important to win the league: to create a team, to create a good spirit with your team, and for sure to have good players.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
